2005.query: Mac management software 2005 Apple enterprise deployment
2005.context: Jamf Holding Corp. is a Apple device management company focused on Apple enterprise management, security, and identity. Founded for Mac management. Casper Suite for enterprises.

competitors.name: Apple Server Admin Tools
competitors.notes: Apple's native server management tools included in OS X Server for basic Mac management capabilities

competitors.name: NetInstall (Apple Server)
competitors.notes: Apple's rudimentary image-management capabilities through NetInstall in Server app for OS X server

competitors.name: DeployStudio
competitors.notes: Free open-source tool for Mac deployment and imaging, filled gaps in Apple's native tools

competitors.name: Radmind
competitors.notes: Early Mac system administration tool suite for managing OS X deployments

2010.context: Jamf Holding Corp. is a Apple device management company focused on Apple enterprise management, security, and identity. iPhone and iPad enterprise management growing.

competitors.name: Microsoft SCCM
competitors.notes: System Center Configuration Manager for Windows

competitors.name: LANDesk
competitors.notes: Endpoint management solutions

competitors.name: MobileIron
competitors.notes: Mobile device management platform

competitors.name: AirWatch
competitors.notes: Enterprise mobility management (acquired by VMware 2014)

competitors.name: Good Technology
competitors.notes: Mobile security and management

competitors.name: Absolute Software
competitors.notes: Device tracking and management

competitors.name: Casper Suite
competitors.notes: Jamf's own product, Apple-focused MDM

2015.query: AirWatch MobileIron Jamf 2015 MDM market Apple device management
2015.context: Jamf Holding Corp. is a Apple device management company focused on Apple enterprise management, security, and identity. Apple enterprise adoption accelerating.

competitors.name: AirWatch (VMware)
competitors.notes: Cross-platform MDM acquired by VMware in 2014, supported iOS, Android, Windows Mobile, BlackBerry. Major MDM player but lacked Jamf's deep Apple expertise

competitors.name: MobileIron
competitors.notes: Comprehensive enterprise mobile management solution focused on security. Strong MDM player but didn't offer Jamf's level of customization for Apple devices

competitors.name: Cisco Meraki
competitors.notes: Cloud-managed IT solutions including MDM capabilities for mobile device management

competitors.name: FileWave
competitors.notes: Multi-platform device management solution supporting Mac, Windows, iOS, and Android

competitors.name: Mosyle
competitors.notes: Apple-focused MDM solution, founded 2012, particularly popular in education sector

competitors.name: Microsoft Intune
competitors.notes: Cross-platform endpoint management with integration into Microsoft ecosystem

competitors.name: Apple Profile Manager
competitors.notes: Apple's built-in MDM solution included with OS X Server

2020.context: Jamf Holding Corp. is a Apple device management company focused on Apple enterprise management, security, and identity. IPO. Remote work drove Apple device deployment.

competitors.name: Microsoft Intune
competitors.notes: Enterprise device management with Windows focus

competitors.name: VMware Workspace ONE
competitors.notes: Unified endpoint management

competitors.name: IBM MaaS360
competitors.notes: Enterprise mobility management

competitors.name: Kandji
competitors.notes: Apple-focused MDM competitor

competitors.name: Mosyle
competitors.notes: Apple device management for education and business

2024.context: Jamf Holding Corp. is a Apple device management company focused on Apple enterprise management, security, and identity. Apple security and identity expansion.

competitors.name: Kandji
competitors.notes: Premier Apple-focused MDM alternative founded 2018. Offers streamlined automation with pre-built Blueprints, eliminating complexity of manual configuration. Zero-touch deployment to compliance enforcement

competitors.name: Mosyle
competitors.notes: Top Apple-only MDM competitor alongside Kandji, particularly strong in education sector. Founded 2012

competitors.name: Addigy
competitors.notes: Prominent Apple-focused MDM platform founded 2013, listed among Jamf's top competitors

competitors.name: Microsoft Intune
competitors.notes: Dominates cross-platform MDM with ~95% market share in endpoint management. Deep integration with Microsoft 365, Azure AD, Windows ecosystems

competitors.name: NinjaOne
competitors.notes: Unified endpoint management with 20,000+ customers. Remotely monitors and manages Windows, macOS, and Linux devices in single pane of glass

competitors.name: Scalefusion
competitors.notes: Cross-platform MDM managing Android, iOS, macOS, Windows, and Linux. Integrates with Apple Business Manager and Apple School Manager

competitors.name: ManageEngine Mobile Device Manager Plus
competitors.notes: Rated as best overall Jamf Pro alternative by G2. Cross-platform device management solution

competitors.name: Rippling IT
competitors.notes: Integrates device management with payroll, benefits, and identity systems. Automated device provisioning and identity management synchronized with HR events

competitors.name: JumpCloud
competitors.notes: Cross-platform MDM and identity management platform, unified directory service

competitors.name: Hexnode
competitors.notes: Cross-platform MDM solution supporting multiple device types

competitors.name: IBM MaaS360
competitors.notes: Enterprise mobility management platform with AI-powered security

2025.context: Jamf Holding Corp. is a Apple device management company focused on Apple enterprise management, security, and identity. Apple enterprise management leader. Competing with Microsoft Intune.

competitors.name: Microsoft Intune
competitors.notes: Dominant cross-platform MDM competitor with nearly 95% market share in endpoint management. Unlike Jamf's Apple-only focus, Intune manages Windows, macOS, iOS, and Android devices from a single console with deep Microsoft 365 and Azure AD integration.

competitors.name: Kandji
competitors.notes: Premier Apple-focused alternative to Jamf. Offers streamlined automation through pre-built Blueprints that eliminate manual configuration complexity. Provides out-of-the-box templates for compliance, security policies, and device setup without requiring custom scripting like Jamf.

competitors.name: NinjaOne
competitors.notes: Unified endpoint management solution serving over 20,000 customers. Cross-platform competitor that remotely monitors and manages Windows, macOS, and Linux devices in a single pane of glass with a 'power through simplicity' philosophy.

competitors.name: ManageEngine Mobile Device Manager Plus
competitors.notes: Rated as the best overall Jamf Pro alternative. Comprehensive MDM solution offering multi-platform device management at competitive pricing.

competitors.name: VMware Workspace ONE UEM
competitors.notes: Competes with Jamf for enterprise MDM. Excels with multi-platform support and advanced analytics, appealing to organizations requiring extensive feature sets and platform flexibility beyond Apple devices.

competitors.name: Addigy
competitors.notes: Apple-focused MDM competitor targeting the same market as Jamf with simplified deployment and management for macOS and iOS devices.

competitors.name: Mosyle
competitors.notes: Apple device management competitor offering MDM capabilities specifically designed for Apple ecosystems at competitive pricing points.

competitors.name: JumpCloud
competitors.notes: Cross-platform directory and MDM solution that competes with Jamf for organizations managing mixed device environments requiring unified identity and access management.
